name: Project
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
Project
description:
Project

Projects are top-level containers in Google Cloud Platform. They store information about billing and authorized users, and they control access to Stackdriver Trace resources. Each project has a friendly name and a unique ID. Projects can be created only in the Google Developers Console.

This class is a client to make API calls for the project’s trace data. Create an instance using Google::Cloud::Trace.new or Google::Cloud#trace. You may then use the get_trace method to retrieve a trace by ID, list_traces to query for a set of traces, and patch_traces to update trace data. You may also use new_trace as a convenience constructor to build a Google::Cloud::Trace::TraceRecord object.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_client = Google::Cloud::Trace.new
traces = trace_client.list_traces Time.now - 3600, Time.now

require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_client = Google::Cloud::Trace.new(
  project: "my-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

trace_client.project #=> "my-project"

methods.name: new_trace
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
Project#new_trace
methods.description: Create a new empty trace record for this project. Uses the current thread’s TraceContext by default; otherwise you may provide a specific TraceContext.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_client = Google::Cloud::Trace.new(
  project: "my-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

trace = trace_client.new_trace

params.name: trace_context
params.description: The context within which to locate this trace (i.e. sets the trace ID and the context parent span, if present.) If the context is set explicitly to nil, a new trace with a new trace ID is created. If no context is provided, the current thread’s context is used.

methods.name: patch_traces
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
Project#patch_traces
methods.description: Sends new traces to Stackdriver Trace or updates existing traces. If the ID of a trace that you send matches that of an existing trace, any fields in the existing trace and its spans are overwritten by the provided values, and any new fields provided are merged with the existing trace data. If the ID does not match, a new trace is created.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_client = Google::Cloud::Trace.new

trace = trace_client.new_trace
trace.in_span "root_span" do
  # Do stuff...
end

trace_client.patch_traces trace

params.name: traces
params.description:
Either a single
trace object or an array of trace objects.

methods.name: get_trace
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
Project#get_trace
methods.description: Gets a single trace by its ID.

params.name: trace_id
params.description: The ID of the trace to fetch.

returns.description: The trace object, or nil if there is no accessible trace with the given ID.

methods.name: list_traces
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
Project#list_traces
methods.description: Returns of a list of traces that match the specified conditions. You must provide a time interval. You may optionally provide a filter, an ordering, a view type. Results are paginated, and you may specify a page size. The result will come with a token you can pass back to retrieve the next page.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_client = Google::Cloud::Trace.new

traces = trace_client.list_traces Time.now - 3600, Time.now
traces.each do |trace|
  puts "Retrieved trace ID: #{trace.trace_id}"
end

params.name: start_time
params.description: The start of the time interval (inclusive).

params.name: end_time
params.description: The end of the time interval (inclusive).

params.name: order_by
params.description: The optional sort order for returned traces. May be trace_id, name, duration, or start. Any sort order may also be reversed by appending desc; for example use start desc to order traces from newest to oldest.

params.name: view
params.description: The optional type of view. Valid values are :MINIMAL, :ROOTSPAN, and :COMPLETE. Default is :MINIMAL.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The size of each page to return. Optional;
if omitted, the service will select a reasonable page size.

params.name: page_token
params.description:
A token indicating the page to return.
Each page of results includes proper token for specifying the
following page.
